title: New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: The New Package Wizard displays a confusing message when creating a new package in the Java IDE.
OB: When invoking the New Java Package wizard, the following message appears at the top: 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists.' This message is displayed even when the package name field is empty.
EB: When invoking the New Java Package Wizard, there should be no message when the package name field is empty. If a message is necessary, it should be a warning and displayed in a different style (e.g., red text) with a corresponding warning icon.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the Java IDE.
2. Go to the New Java Package Wizard.
3. Leave the package name field empty and attempt to create a new package. The confusing message should appear.
